body:
@alalazo This seems to be an unintended consequence of the addition of multi-valued variants. I tried installing a new package to a Spack installation from before multi-valued variants existed and now I see:
```
==> Error: CorruptDatabaseError: Invalid record in Spack database: hash: plrlzuulbe7huekbvkh4vl6rruimhkpi, cause: MultipleValuesInExclusiveVariantError: multiple values are not allowed for variant "nprocs"
```
Is this another case of "Spack should use the package.py from when it was installed, not the current one"?
title: CorruptDatabaseError: Invalid record in Spack database
